'PROMISING PRACTICES" - FILM 4
PAGE 2
VIDEO
AUDIO
2. MS. NARRATOR WITH
DINOSAUR PICTURE VISIBLE.
NARRATOR: (SYNC) And I keep his
picture around to remind me WHY he
wasn't.
Small drops in temperature. . . to which
the dinosaur couldn't adjust. . . finally
wiped him off the face of the earth.
3. CU. DINOSAUR PICTURE
NARRATOR: (OFFSCREEN) Our
enormous friend, there, could cope
with almost anything. . . except CHANGE.'
4. MLS. NARRATOR
NARRATOR: (SYNC) Quite some time
later, my kind of animal came along.
In comparison with the dinosaur. . .
you'd have to fault us humans on
dimension and general puniness of
structure.
5. NARRATOR. ANOTHER
ANGLE.
NARRATOR: (SYNC) But we have one
vital quality which doesn't show up in a
superficial comparison of externals.
Adaptability. That's our human hall-
mark. Flexibility in the face of change.
